page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: With no schools in the block, children must travel to school. Primary schools are in adjoining villages of Hopton and Rickinghall. To attend middle school the children travel on average approx. 7 miles to Stanton, on a school bus supplied by the County Council. The Upper School is at Thurston, which is a bus journey of approx.15 miles. For further education there is a college at Bury St. Edmunds which has a limited range of vocational courses as well as G.C.E. 'O' & 'A' level courses for more mature students. The technical college at Ipswich has a wider choice of courses. Some evening classes are run by the Education Dept. of the County Council, a few at Hopton school, at Walsham-Le-Willows, and at Ixworth with a wider choice at Bury St. Edmunds.
